lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first)
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1. Click `Configure` > `Structure for New Projects` and then `Project Settings` > `Project` > `Project SDK`
1. If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11
1. Import the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.

1. After the importing is complete, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.Duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below:

* Loads the save data and greets.
* Saves the data to save data file and says goodbye.
* @param cmdType Determine whether this command is TODO, EVENT or DEADLINE.
* Checks the validity of this command and build a todo task.
* @throws DukeException When command argument is invalid.
throw new DukeException("Invalid argument: Argument field cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("Invalid argument: Content field is blank");
* Checks the validity of this command and build a event task.
* @throws DukeException When command argument is invalid.
throw new DukeException("Invalid argument: Argument field cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("Invalid argument: /at not detected or no argument before /at.");
throw new DukeException("Void argument: Content field is blank");
throw new DukeException("Void argument: Time field is blank");
throw new DukeException("Incorrect time format: Correct format is yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");
* Checks the validity of this command and build a deadline task.
* @throws DukeException When command argument is invalid.
throw new DukeException("Invalid argument: Argument field cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("Invalid argument: /by not detected or no argument before /by.");
throw new DukeException("Void argument: Content field is blank");
throw new DukeException("Void argument: Time field is blank");
throw new DukeException("Incorrect time format: Correct format is yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");
* Executes and prints command according to its command type.
* @param list Passes TaskList in case of reading and writing to the list.
* @throws DukeException When encounter an error in command argument.
public String executeAndPrint(TaskList list) throws DukeException {
+ (list.getSize() == 1 ? " task in the list\n" : " tasks in the list\n");
return "Test usage: this is a TODO command";
return "Test usage: this is a DEADLINE command";
return "Test usage: this is an EVENT command";
* @param list Passes TaskList in case of reading and writing to the list.

public abstract String executeAndPrint(TaskList list) throws DukeException;
* Execute and print a delete command.

* @throws DukeException When encounter an error in command argument.
public String executeAndPrint(TaskList list) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Invalid Argument: Input must to be integer");
+ (list.getSize() == 1 ? " task in the list\n" : " tasks in the list\n");
return "No such task in the list\n";
return "Test usage: this is a DELETE command";
* Execute and print a done command.
* @param list Passes TaskList in case of reading and writing to the list.
* @throws DukeException When encounter an error in command argument.
public String executeAndPrint(TaskList list) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Invalid Argument: Input must to be integer");
return "This task is marked as done: \n"
return "No such task in the list\n";
return "Test usage: this is a DONE command";

return "Test usage: this is an EXIT command";

* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.
* Initializes the displayed screen to the specified state.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* Sets isDone to false by default.
* @param description Parsed string contains description of this task.
* Y is done, N is not done.
